title: 2 injured in overnight Bastrop shooting
content:
An overnight shooting in Bastrop has left one child and one adult in the hospital.
Police Chief Allen Campbell said the department received a call to 320 Ogden Ave. in reference to gunshots being fired with two people injured.
Campbell said the shooting was related to ongoing dispute stemming from a fight among of a group of children that happened over one month ago.
On Wednesday night, the dispute elevated, and a 18-year-old woman was shot in the stomach, arm and leg. An eight-year-old child was also shot.
Campbell said both victims were airlifted to hospitals in Shreveport and Jackson. Both are recovering, but the adult woman is expected to undergo surgery Thursday.
One suspect, Calvin Willis, 18, North Todd is in custody and is facing two counts of attempted second degree murder. Campbell said two additional suspects have been identified and are being sought by the BPD.
Information concerning their identities is not being released at this point in the investigation.
